body.name: Evenflo Gold Otto Self-Folding Lightweight Travel Stroller (Sapphire Blue)

features: INSTANT FOLDING SATISFACTION: With one-hand activation, the Otto folds on its own— making it quick and easy to use
INFANT CAR SEAT READY: Designed to work seamlessly with the Evenflo Gold SecureMax Infant Car Seat with SensorSafe, the Evenflo LiteMax Infant Car Seat and the Evenflo SafeMax Infant Car Seat
FOLD & GO: When the stroller is folded, the bumper bar doubles as a carry handle, making it easy to lift up and take along with you
THE GOLD DIFFERENCE: Evenflo Gold combines smart innovation, fresh, modern style, and premium fabrics and finishes to make every stroll a first-class ride
CRUISING COMFORT: 2-position adjustable footrest and 2-position canopy with peek-a-boo window make for happier travels with little ones
STREAMLINE YOUR STROLL: Zippered storage makes it easy to stow away and protect your cell phone, car keys and valuables
body.description: Love the look, feel and ease of the stylish ride that folds in a flash: the Evenflo® Gold Otto™ Self-Folding Stroller. It's the smart solution you need for the everyday juggling act. Simply use one hand to activate the automatic folding operation; use the other to hold your baby. Part of the Evenflo Gold collection, the Otto offers the ideal combination for busy and style-conscious parents—smart innovation with luxe touches, including an accent bumper bar, harness covers and a 2-panel canopy with an oversized peek-a-boo window. Designed for kids up to 55 lb, this extended use stroller grows with your child and delivers a smooth ride, mile after mile, thanks to front suspension. Discover a whole new level of convenience, premium style, and instant gratification—roll with the Gold fold. Evenflo Gold Otto Self-Folding Stroller is a product of Evenflo, a trusted source of precision manufactured, high-quality children’s products for over 100 years. Our team takes a proactive approach to the design of our car seats, strollers and travel systems, delivering value and convenience with a relentless focus on safety. If you need tips on ensuring the safest ride for your child, Evenflo Gold Consumer Care is here to guide you. Our experts are parents, too. So they get your priorities, your high standards, and your need for the very best service and support.

productInformation.name: Care instructions
productInformation.value: Clean minor spills and stains on cloth, vinyl or plastic surfaces with cold water and mild soap. Air dry. On models with removable seat pads, machine wash them separately in cold water–delicate cycle. NO chlorine bleach. Tumble dry 10 – 15 minutes on low heat, remove immediately. DO NOT iron or dry clean. Metal and plastic parts can be wiped clean with a soft damp cloth and dried with a soft cloth. DO NOT use abrasive cleaners.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: In addition to the Evenflo Gold SecureMax Infant Car Seat, the Otto is compatible with all models of the LiteMax and SafeMax Infant Car Seats, making Otto a great travel stroller that complements our most popular infant car seats and travel systems.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great value. Baby sleeps comfortably
reviews.reviewText: As advertised. Self Folds and stands upright. Easy to fold and unfold. Very handy when you have your other hand full. The bumper bar doubles as the handle.Not as much big or bulky as a graco but still solid and lighter; does not feel flimsy at all. Baby is so comfortable in it. Falls fast asleep. The extendable/foldable part is handy so their legs don’t hang. Does not lie completely flat but still good. Canopy is big enough to cover them and can extend when you unzip the peekaboo window. Adequate storage underneath and handy pocket behind. Cup holder included so it’s very helpful. Not as small or light as a GB pockit stroller so it’s not as travel friendly as it won’t fit in overhead compartment but you can just check it in at the gate. Got a great deal for cyber Monday. We’re very happy with it. Def recommend this. The green/blue is nice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great compact stroller! I love how it easily folds and can fit into my car trunk. I also like how I can use the stroller without the car seat attached like my son is using it in the picture. I also have the compatible car seat and love that I can easy click it in the stroller while my son sleeps and I shop!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I love it all but the wheels
reviews.reviewText: I used this stroller as a step up from my Besrey one step fold infant stroller that I used for 3 years. It is bigger and heavier (with reason, as it is to accommodate more weight and size) so that wasn’t too bad. It was perfect to travel (land and air) with. The only catch for me was that the wheels are tight and squeaky. I tried using WD40 but the problem persisted and there’s no way to fix it.Overall, I think the pros outweigh the cons.Pros: color and material are good, easy to fold and unfold (as promised) and can be done with one hand, Convenient travel stroller, reclining seat, removable cup holder that expands to fit cup contours, good basket space, leg space can move up or down. Cons: front wheels squeak even when you use WD40 and they aren’t as fluid in movement as past strollers (sometimes they need more of a nudge to turn and move)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Overall no regrets.
reviews.reviewText: The quality is really good. I love that the bar opens up to make it easier to get them in and out. I do wish there was a snack tray. It also did not con with a rain cover. The main thing I would change if I could is the umbrella. When it is pulled all the way back it gets in the way of the handle. It also arches higher than the handle when pulled back which I feel like looks kinda weird. The front wheels do squeak but not all the time. It’s also not the wheel that squeaks it’s the part that allows the wheels to pivot for turning. The height is fine for me. I am 5’2” and a lot of people didn’t like the height but it wasn’t that bad for me. Not a deal breaker. Again overall I do love it but like anything it doesn’t check all my boxes but it does check most of them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A five-star travel companion at an irresistible price
reviews.reviewText: This lightweight stroller is a true gem! The Evenflo Gold Otto combines convenience, style, and functionality seamlessly. The self-folding feature is a game-changer, making travel a breeze. The Sapphire Blue color is not only visually appealing but also stands out in a crowd. Every penny spent on this stroller is worth it, and the additional discounted price makes it an even better deal. It's a top-notch investment for parents seeking quality and convenience in a travel stroller.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fixing the squeaky wheel
reviews.reviewText: I never really reviews, but I bought the stroller for less than $100 because so many of them get returned because of the squeaky wheel issue. It came to us in Like New condition. I'm going to guess because of the squeaky wheels upfront.As suspected when I bought it, it came with two squeaky front wheels. I put WD-40 on the wheel area and the problem persisted. I got down on my hands and knees and listened as my son sat in the stroller to listen to where the squeaking was actually coming from. The spot in the photo that is circled is where the noise was coming from. Added some WD- 40 to that area and boom, problem fixed!I do think an almost $200 stroller should come without squeaky wheels, but since I paid less than $100 for one that was brand new (returned, but obviously brand new) I'm not complaining about a simple fix.Hope this helps someone else!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars evenflo missed the mark!
reviews.reviewText: we’ve been an evenflo gold family since day one and have always been so impressed with their products but this stroller was SUCH a disappointment. i took a gamble on the otto stroller and assumed that at worst, some 3D-40 spray would fix any squeakiness. to my surprise, the wheels didn’t squeak! however, they did rattle and wobble constantly while pushing— even across perfectly smooth floors in a medical building. even after taking a look at the wheels when we got home, i couldn’t find a way to tighten them at all to help with the rattling. additionally, the handlebar is SO tall! at 5’3”, i realize that i’m on the short side— our evenflo gold pivot xpand has an adjustable handlebar that allows both my husband (6’1”) and myself to comfortably push it, but the otto has a stationary handle that i’d venture to guess would be uncomfortably tall for anyone under 5’6” or so. the basket is rather small which i don’t particularly mind, but the configuration of the handlebar & seatback make it impossible to use any sort of stroller caddy/organizer (which, for me, is an absolute must when traveling). i also felt like the canopy itself was very wide & cumbersome looking— it extends past the sides of the stroller frame itself and looks rather awkward. the footrest also felt poorly constructed and provided very little in the way of leg support. while not an issue for my petite one year old, i would imagine that it may not work well for older toddlers/kids.disappointed to be sending this one back, but it just isn’t the evenflo gold quality that i was hoping for.cons:-rattling, wobbly front wheels-very tall handlebar-no space to attach a stroller caddy/organizer-flimsy footrest-very wide and awkward looking canopypros:-easy to fold/unfold-nice fabric & finishes-lightweight and compact

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lightweight, functional, compact
reviews.reviewText: Great stroller! Super lightweight, folds/unfolds with one hand like shown. I’m 5’8 and the handlebar is a perfect height for me.
Es muy compacta y facil de transportar
Recommended for travel stroller!! Very convenient and light weight easy to fold and carry around!!

For the price point I thought I had snagged a great deal however when it arrived it was much bulkier than expected. Previously used a mimosa cabin City+ and decided to get a larger reclinable stroller. Was expecting it to be as portable as the cabin city+ and alas it was not. Almost 3 kgs heavier and the auto fold did not make up for the bulkiness. Returned this and purchased the GB pockit plus instead and albeit more expensive, it’s fitting the bill better.
